page.title: 19MANOR GRANGE FARM
page.content: Farm buildings built l6th Century, modernised l765 by Leonard Copley. l965 buildings demolished,new ones built by Cllr. Hardy.Mr & Mrs Hardy purchased it l954.Now owned by J.R. Hardy & Son.280 acres is farmed 400 prior to construction of Al(M).Wheat, barley,potatoes grown-recently sugar beet,oil seed,rape & peas added. Machinery includes combine,tractors, various other implements.Some beast for beef,mainly deals in pigs. Approximately 3000 pigs-breeds Landrace, Large White Cross. Before invasion of machinery,could be 30 farm labourers during harvest,now 5 men working fulltime.Chemical fertilizer used and slurry.Pigs sold commercially in bulk,except sows which are marketed.Land stretches from rear of farm southerly direction to High Melton.Some land rented for potatoes.
